    Cookie

    This document informs users about the technologies that help this website achieve the purposes described below. These technologies allow the Owner to access and store information (e.g., using cookies) or use resources (e.g., by running a script) on a user's device as they interact with this website.

    For simplicity, all such technologies are defined in this document as "Settings" (these are Google Consent Mode settings) - unless there is a reason to differentiate.

    Personal data provided to us by users via email, contact form, etc. will be processed to respond to user inquiries. Users are not obligated to provide us with their personal data, but we will not be able to respond to their email inquiries without an email address.

    For example, while cookies can be used in both web browsers and mobile browsers, talking about cookies in the context of mobile applications would be inaccurate as these are browser-based settings. For this reason, the term "cookies" is used in this document only when it refers to this specific type of setting.

    Some of the purposes for which Settings are used may also require the User's consent. Whenever consent is given, it can be freely withdrawn at any time by following the instructions in this document.

    This website uses Settings managed directly by the Owner (so-called "basic" Settings) and Settings that enable the use of services provided by third parties (so-called "third-party" Settings). Unless otherwise specified in this document, third-party providers may access their managed Settings.

    The validity and expiration date of cookies and other similar Settings may vary depending on the expiration date set by the Owner or the relevant provider. Some of them expire when the User's browsing session ends.

    In addition to what is specified in the descriptions within each of the categories below, Users may find more precise and updated information regarding term specifications, as well as any other relevant information - such as the presence of other Settings - in the linked privacy policies of the respective third-party providers or by contacting the Owner.

    How this website uses parameters

    Necessary

    This website uses so-called "technical" cookies and other similar settings to perform actions that are absolutely necessary for the operation or provision of the Service.

    Analytics

    This website uses parameters to measure traffic and analyze user behavior to improve the service.

    Preferences

    This website uses Settings to provide basic interactions and functions, allowing users to access selected Service features and facilitating user communication with the Owner.

    Marketing

    This website uses parameters to display personalized ads or marketing content and to measure their effectiveness.

    Google Consent Mode Settings

    (1) ad_storage:

    • Responsible for storing and accessing data used in analytics.

    (2) analytics_storage:

    • Responsible for storing and accessing data used in analytics.

    (3) functionality_storage:

    • Enables saving data used to improve site functionality.

    (4) personalization:

    • Allows the use of data for content personalization.

    (5) security_storage:

    • Enables storing data used for security purposes.

    Why is this important?

    • These settings allow website owners to comply with GDPR, CCPA and other data protection regulations.
    • Users have greater control over how their data is processed.

    How to manage settings on this site

    Users can set or update their preferences using the appropriate privacy settings panel available on this site.

    Regarding any third-party Settings, users can manage their preferences using the appropriate opt-out link (if available), using the means specified in the third party's privacy policy, or by contacting the third party.

    How to control or delete cookies and similar technologies using device settings

    Users can use their own browser settings. However, browser settings do not allow for detailed consent control by category. For example, users can find information about managing cookies in the most commonly used browsers.

    Users can also control certain categories of settings used in mobile applications by opting out using appropriate device settings, such as mobile advertising settings or general tracking settings (users can open device settings and find the appropriate setting).

    How to opt out of interest-based advertising

    Regardless of the above, Users may follow the instructions provided by YourOnlineChoices (EU and UK), Network Advertising Initiative (USA) and Digital Advertising Alliance (USA), DAAC (Canada), DDAI (Japan) or other similar services. Such initiatives allow users to select tracking preferences for most advertising tools. Therefore, the Owner encourages Users to use these resources in addition to the information provided in this document.

    Consequences of not using Google Consent Mode settings

    Users are free to decide whether they want to authorize the use of Settings. However, please note that Settings help this Website provide Users with better experiences and improved features (in accordance with the purposes specified in this document). Therefore, if the User decides to block the use of Parameters, the Owner may not be able to provide appropriate features.
